example: How many murders is it going to take before you start believing that this maniac's out there?

definition: In the manner of a maniac; insane; frenzied.

example: One Catholic chronicler contends that this question is “a serious obstacle to faith” for many.

definition: Something that impedes, stands in the way of, or holds up progress

example: Kindly convey us thither with the utmost discretion.
example_meaning: Vui lòng đưa chúng ta tới đó một cách vô cùng kín đáo.
definition: (dated) To that place (rare except for literary or legal use).

definition: Striking, or dashing together; fighting; contending; struggling to resist and overcome.

example: Some think of such trust merely as a feeling, a kind of blissful emotion that should well up naturally in the heart.

example: philosophy
example_meaning: Đó là triết lý sống

example: Clever manipulation might gain you a little freedom, but in the long run, it only prolongs family strife .

definition: Violent conflict, usually brief or limited in nature.

example: That body probably decayed and returned to the ground.
example_meaning: Có lẽ thân thể đó đã bị mục nát và trở về cát bụi rồi.

example: They were not distracted by his status or position.
example_meaning: Họ không phải bận tâm nghĩ đến thân thế hay địa vị của ngài.

example: sing their parts — soprano, alto, tenor and bass —
example_meaning: hát phần của họ — nữ cao , nữ trầm, nam cao và nam trầm —

example: And ultimately , it seems to me, that always works better than propaganda.
example_meaning: Và cuối cùng , đối với tôi, điều đó tốt hơn nhiều so với tuyên truyền.
definition: Indicating the last item.

example: They invented that tradition for their arrival here.

example_meaning: Đó là phương thuốc kéo dài sự sống cơ sở của thuật giả kim .

example: Inside a yurt
example_meaning: Bên trong một lều yurt

A thin, all-cotton fabric, commonly striped, used to make clothing for summer wear.

example: He's gonna squash us in this sardine can.

definition: Any one of several small species of herring which are commonly preserved in olive oil or in tins for food, especially the pilchard, or European sardine (Clupea pichardus). The California sardine (Clupea sagax) is similar. The American sardines of the Atlantic coast are mostly the young of the common herring and of the menhaden.
